cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi (140 km) ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest this morning, turning north tonight, then accelerating north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast on Wednesday and continuing northeast across the southern Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic on Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Grand Isle area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mississippi/Alabama border; Storm Surge Warning Intracoastal City LA to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Warning Mississippi/Alabama border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL and Punta Allen to Progreso MX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle Wednesday, then inland across Alabama, Georgia, the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic coast (including Virginia) late Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force gusts possible late Thursday (20-35 kt sustained, higher gusts) with a 23 % chance of ≥34 kt sustained winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible with onshore flow Thursday night.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands 2–4 inches could cause brief flooding in low-lying and terminal areas Thursday-Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine squalls and isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out as the weakening system crosses Virginia.
